content: And whoever fears Allah, He will make for him a way out and provide for him from where he does not expect.
The believer is not one who eats his fill while his neighbor goes hungry.
Indeed, with hardship comes ease. Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
Whoever would love to have his sins forgiven and his lifespan extended, let him maintain family ties.
O Allah, I seek refuge in You from worry and grief, from incapacity and laziness.
And whoever relies upon Allah, then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose.
The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, although both are good.
Our Lord, give us good in this world and good in the hereafter and save us from the punishment of the Fire.
And it is He who created the heavens and earth in truth. The day He says 'Be,' and it is, His word is the truth.
Whoever removes a worldly grief from a believer, Allah will remove from him one of the griefs of the Day of Judgment.
And remember your Lord within yourself in humility and in private without announcing it in the mornings and the evenings.
The most beloved of deeds to Allah are those that are most consistent, even if they are small.
O Allah, make my religion easy for me by virtue of which my affairs are protected.
And whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, while being a believer, those will enter Paradise.
Be mindful of Allah, and Allah will protect you. Be mindful of Allah, and you will find Him in front of you.
